title: Ticket #4907: Accept ClassAd expression as constraints for the python bindings
description:
The constraint argument passed to the Schedd.query and Collector.query functions has been a wart on the API design - reflecting the HTCondor internals, it only accepts a string (which is internally parsed as a ClassAd expression).

We should allow ExprTree objects to be used directly; we should also accept simple casts (python 'True' to classad 'true').

To maintain backward compatibility, strings passed to as constraints should not be converted to a ClassAd string value - instead, they should be parsed as a ClassAd expression.
remarks:
2015-Feb-21 11:16:44 by bbockelm:
For example, the following are broken: 

schedd.query(False)
schedd.query(classad.ExprTree('Owner=?="osg"'))

but this is acceptable: 

schedd.query("false")
schedd.query('Owner=?="osg"')

Both mechanisms should be fine.

2015-Feb-21 11:25:14 by bbockelm:
Pushed fix, including version history.

No changes to the manual as the reference for these functions already claimed this worked!
